title: Photoblog comparison
intro: Two prominent U.S. hospitals are preparing to launch trials with diabetics and chronic disease patients using Apple Inc.'s HealthKit, offering a glimpse of how the iPhone maker's ambitious take on health care will work in practice.

mainImage.text: The Brandenburg Gate, arguably Berlin’s most famous symbol, remained in ruins for the Cold War period and beyond due to its location right next to the Berlin Wall. It was fully restored from 2000 to 2002.

mainImage.imgAltText1: A face mask and a Santa hat
mainImage.text: Red Army troops pose in front of the Reichstag, where furious room-to-room fighting took place on April 30, 1945. It’s now been restored as the seat of the German parliament, with Norman Foster’s iconic glass cupola making it a major tourist attraction.
Muller, a U.S. photographer of Prime on assignment for National Geographic/The Washington Post
